snippet: Investors were predicting that Portugal would be next to impose losses on bondholders as it struggled to meet the terms of a 78 billion-euro bailout.
abstract: Investors predict that as Greece nears a big debt deal, Portugal will be next to impose losses on bondholders as it struggles to meet the terms of a 78 billion-euro ($103 billion) bailout; country, which is plunging into deep recession, is seen as soon asking for a similar debt agreement with creditors.

byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis in Athens and Stephen Castle in Brussels contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Investors were predicting that Portugal would be next to impose losses on bondholders as it struggled to meet the terms of a 78 billion-euro bailout.

headline.seo: As Talks in Greece Continue, Investors Now Worry About Portugal
headline.main: As Greece Nears a Big Debt Deal, Investors Now Fret That Portugal Will Ask for the Same
headline.print_headline: As Greece Nears a Big Debt Deal, Investors Now Fret That Portugal Will Ask for the Same
